text:
I think you asked the right question how much free space on the Windows RE
partition does the WinRE patch require, not necessarily how much space it
has(used and/or free or the total). I guess, going by the article on how to
shrink and resize - since it indicates shrinking the os partition by 250 MB, and
recreating the Recovery with the freed-up space then 250 MB could be the amount
needed. ....but that could be faulty reasoning(yes, being suspicious sometimes
has value) since MSFT when writing those directions assumed that some amount of
free space was already present or the partition was already larger than it's
initial common size of 500 MB(i.e. the article did not clearly state how much
free space was needed). On this device exploring the Recovery partition shows
that after successfully installing the Jan 2024 update, the winre.wim file is
818 MB while the entire Windows Recovery partition is 829 MB(another utility
reports the partition as 825 MB). The winre.wim file post update has a date of
Jan 09, 2024. The create and modify dates are also the same date, but there is a
26 minute difference in the creation and modified date. Didn't track the time of
the update download and install in Windows Update, but the restart sequence to
finish installing the update took less than 4 minutes. - on this system the size
of WinRE before the update was ~630 GB, thus it grew by about 199 MB with this,
one single January 2023 update....and it's been growing from slightly more than
500GB since June 2023 when WinRE updates were initially included in cumulative
updates. ...w
